reviews.review_msg: I never felt as like I belonged in the class as much as I did in her class throughout any of my semesters at SFU. Her engagement and helpfulness made the course incredibly fun. Her energy is always positive.  The guidebook project was one of the most memorable projects in my SFU life. You will never get bored with her course.
She displays a very caring and excited attitude about teaching the class, she always tries to make the class as fun as possible and more oriented around fun activities instead of textbook reading.

Amazing instructor!!! Lectures are fun, well-structured and very very interactive. Assignments and exams are fair. She seemed to be a bit particular about kanji accuracy. However, she is good at explaining things and very knowledgeable. Morishita is hilarious and very inspirational! Take her course!! I wish she teaches 110 level, too.

She encourages students to participate regardless of their knowledge level and is a helpful and punctual teacher. She is honest, supportive, kind, and positive!!  You must frequently review the assignments listed in the syllabus if you want to receive a decent mark. 
Overall, it's a fun class to be in!!

Morishita sensei is extremely good at creating a comfortable and engaging environment.  
She is super friendly, kind and supportive. She exceeded my expectations for a language professor in every way.  Participation does matter, show up to all her classes.  Finish your Homework ahead of time.  Overall, definitely fun class to take!! Recommended.
